data.title: Apple to Open New Satellite Headquarters in Santa Cruz, California — Santa Cruz Works
data.meta_description: Apple to open new headquarters in Santa Cruz.
data.text:
Cupertino, California – Apple announced today that it will be expanding its operations by opening a new satellite headquarters in Santa Cruz, California. This move marks a significant milestone for the tech giant, as it continues to expand its footprint and drive innovation across the globe.

The new headquarters will be located in the heart of Santa Cruz, just a few miles from the bustling city center. The facility will serve as a hub for research and development, as well as a base for Apple's growing workforce in the area.

"Santa Cruz is an incredibly vibrant and innovative community, and we're thrilled to be a part of it," said a representative of Apple. "Our new satellite headquarters will be a place where some of the brightest minds in technology can collaborate, ideate, and create the next generation of Apple products and services."

The new facility will be state-of-the-art, featuring cutting-edge technology and world-class amenities. The design of the building will be inspired by the natural beauty of the surrounding area, with a focus on sustainability and energy efficiency.

"We're committed to being good neighbors and stewards of the environment," said the Apple rep. "Our new facility will be a model for sustainable design and construction, and we're excited to work with the local community to ensure that it reflects the values and character of Santa Cruz."

The new headquarters will also create jobs in the area, with Apple planning to hire thousands of employees across a variety of disciplines. The company will work closely with local universities and colleges to recruit the best and brightest talent in the region. The announcement of the new headquarters was met with excitement and enthusiasm from local officials and community leaders.

"We're thrilled to welcome Apple to Santa Cruz," said the Mayor of Santa Cruz. "This is a significant investment in our community, and we look forward to working with Apple to create jobs, drive economic growth, and promote innovation in our region."

Construction on the new headquarters is expected to begin later this year, with a target completion date of April 1, 2025. Apple is committed to working with the local community throughout the construction process, with a focus on minimizing disruption and maximizing community engagement.
